cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the central Caribbean, expected to turn northwest then north-northwest, passing south of Jamaica, near or over the Cayman Islands, then toward western Cuba and later the Florida Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba (Pinar del Río/Isle of Youth area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Cayman Islands; Tropical Storm Watch – Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central/Western Caribbean, Cayman Islands, western Cuba, Florida Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤16%) of tropical-storm-force winds late next week; peak probability in ~5 days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the northeast Florida coast based on current track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible 29–30 Sep if the storm crosses the peninsula, but current guidance suggests modest totals (<4 in).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches mid- to late week.
